Foundation Health Analyzer

Complete Documentation - Analyze, monitor, and optimize your ServiceNow instance

Version {{c.version}} Updated {{c.lastUpdated}} Scope: {{c.data.scope}} Production Ready

Overview

Foundation Health Analyzer (FHA) is a comprehensive ServiceNow application designed to analyze, monitor, and assess the health of your ServiceNow tables and configurations. It provides detailed insights into table structure, automation, integrations, security, and quality.

Key Features

Deep Analysis

Comprehensive analysis of tables, fields, business rules, and scripts with configurable depth.

29 Rule Handlers

Built-in detection rules for common issues, anti-patterns, and best practice violations.

Health Scoring

0-100 health score based on severity-weighted issues with clear interpretation guidelines.

REST API

Complete REST API with 8 endpoints for automation and integration.

Service Portal UI

Modern, responsive dashboard with detailed analysis results and filtering.

Export Reports

Generate JSON and Word document reports for documentation and compliance.

Quick Start

Prerequisites

  • Role Required: x_1310794_founda_0.admin or x_1310794_founda_0.user
  • ServiceNow Version: Paris or later (recommended)
  • Service Portal: Must be enabled

Three Ways to Run Analysis

1. Service Portal (Recommended)

1. Navigate to: /fha 2. Select a configuration from dropdown 3. Click "Run Analysis" 4. View results when complete

2. REST API

POST /api/x_1310794_founda_0/fha/analyze/incident Content-Type: application/json Authorization: Basic <credentials> { "deep_scan": true, "include_children_tables": false }

3. Script Background

var analyzer = new x_1310794_founda_0.FHAnalyzer(); var result = analyzer.runAnalysis('CONFIG_SYS_ID'); gs.info('Health Score: ' + result.health_score); gs.info('Issues: ' + result.issues_found);

Your First Analysis (5 Minutes)

  1. Create a configuration in x_1310794_founda_0_configurations table
  2. Select a small table (e.g., incident, problem)
  3. Enable basic options only (no deep_scan initially)
  4. Run analysis from portal
  5. Review health score and issues

Success Criteria: A health score above 70 indicates good table health. Focus on high and medium severity issues first.

Configuration Options

FHA provides flexible configuration options to control analysis depth and scope.

Configuration Options

Option Type Default Description
deep_scan Boolean false Enable script content analysis (detects eval(), hardcoded sys_ids, etc.)
include_children_tables Boolean false Include child tables in analysis (e.g., task → incident)
include_ldap Boolean false Include LDAP-related checks (for sys_user, sys_user_group)
ignore_servicenow_records Boolean true Ignore OOB ServiceNow records (sys_created_by = system)

Configuration Scenarios

Quick Health Check

  • deep_scan: ❌
  • include_children: ❌
  • include_ldap: ❌

Use: Fast overview, basic metrics

Standard Analysis

  • deep_scan: ✅
  • include_children: ❌
  • include_ldap: ❌

Use: Recommended for most tables

Full Table Family

  • deep_scan: ✅
  • include_children: ✅
  • include_ldap: ❌

Use: Analyze table + all children

Identity Management

  • deep_scan: ✅
  • include_children: ✅
  • include_ldap: ✅

Use: sys_user, sys_user_group analysis

Health Score Calculation

score = 100 for each issue: if severity == 'high': score -= 15 if severity == 'medium': score -= 5 if severity == 'low': score -= 2 return max(0, score)
Score Range Status Guidance
70 - 100 Good Monitor and address minor items
40 - 69 Needs Attention Plan medium/high remediations
0 - 39 Critical Immediate action on high issues

REST API Reference

FHA provides a complete REST API for automation and integration.

Base URL

https://<instance>.service-now.com/api/x_1310794_founda_0/fha

Authentication

All endpoints require HTTP Basic Authentication with one of these roles:

  • x_1310794_founda_0.admin - Full access
  • x_1310794_founda_0.user - Read-only access

Available Endpoints

Method Endpoint Description
GET /tables List all available configurations
POST /analyze/{table_name} Run analysis by table name
POST /analyze_by_config/{id} Run analysis by configuration ID
GET /analysis/{analysis_id} Get detailed analysis result
GET /fields?table_name={name} Get custom fields with fill rates
GET /history Get paginated analysis history
GET /statistics Get global statistics
POST /report/word Generate Word document report

Example: Run Analysis

POST /api/x_1310794_founda_0/fha/analyze/incident Content-Type: application/json Authorization: Basic <credentials> { "deep_scan": true, "include_children_tables": false } Response (200): { "success": true, "analysis_id": "abc123...", "health_score": 75, "issues_count": 12, "message": "Analysis completed" }

Complete API Documentation: For detailed request/response examples for all endpoints, see CONSOLIDATED_DOCUMENTATION.md § REST API Reference.

Rule Handlers

FHA includes 29 built-in rule handlers for detecting common issues and anti-patterns.

Handler Categories

Data Quality (8)

  • inactive - Inactive records
  • unused_field - 0% fill rate
  • low_fill_rate - Low usage
  • duplicate_field - Duplicates
  • missing_field - Required missing

Code Quality (7)

  • hardcoded_sys_id - Hardcoded IDs
  • eval_usage - eval() usage
  • console_log - Debug logs
  • current_update - Recursion risk
  • query_no_limit - Missing setLimit()

Performance (6)

  • size_threshold - Size limits
  • count_threshold - Count limits
  • br_density - Too many BRs
  • sync_ajax - Synchronous calls
  • gs_sleep - Sleep usage

Custom (8)

  • system_created - System records
  • pattern_scan - Custom patterns
  • field_check - Field validation
  • aggregate_metric - Metrics

Top 10 Most Useful Handlers

Handler Severity Detects
unused_field High Custom fields with 0% fill rate (never used)
hardcoded_sys_id High Hardcoded sys_ids in scripts (portability issue)
eval_usage Critical eval() usage in scripts (security risk)
current_update Critical current.update() in Business Rules (recursion risk)
low_fill_rate Medium Fields with low usage (<10% fill rate)
br_density Medium Too many Business Rules on table (>20)
inactive Low Inactive records that could be cleaned up
console_log Low console.log() instead of gs.log()
query_no_limit Medium GlideRecord queries without setLimit()
duplicate_field Medium Custom fields duplicating OOTB fields

Complete Handler Reference: For detailed documentation of all 29 handlers with parameters and examples, see docs/handlers/HANDLERS_REFERENCE.md.

Troubleshooting

Common issues and their solutions.

Configuration Not Found

Symptom: Analysis fails with "Configuration not found"

Cause: Configuration record is inactive or deleted

Solution:

var config = new GlideRecord('x_1310794_founda_0_configurations'); config.addQuery('sys_id', 'YOUR_CONFIG_SYS_ID'); config.addQuery('active', true); config.query(); if (!config.next()) { gs.error('Configuration not found or inactive'); }

Empty Results in Widget

Symptom: Analysis completes but no data shows in widget

Cause: details field not populated in results record

Solution:

  • Run a new analysis (old analyses may not have JSON details)
  • Check browser console for JavaScript errors
  • Verify details field contains valid JSON

Slow Analysis Performance

Symptom: Analysis takes >5 minutes to complete

Cause: Large table + deep_scan + children tables

Solution:

  • Disable deep_scan for initial runs
  • Set include_children_tables=false
  • Add filters to verification items (encoded query)
  • Run analysis during off-peak hours

REST API 403 Forbidden

Symptom: API calls return 403 error

Cause: Missing role or incorrect authentication

Solution:

  • Verify user has x_1310794_founda_0.admin or .user role
  • Check HTTP Basic Auth credentials
  • Review REST API ACLs in system

Debug Mode

Enable debug logging for troubleshooting:

gs.setProperty('x_1310794_founda_0.debug', 'true'); // View logs in: System Logs // Filter: source = x_1310794_founda_0

Warning: Debug mode generates verbose logs. Only enable for troubleshooting and disable after resolving issues.

Best Practices

For Administrators

Performance

  • Start with basic analysis before deep_scan
  • Use include_children_tables only when needed
  • Schedule analyses during off-peak hours
  • Archive old results periodically

Configuration

  • Create separate configs for different analysis types
  • Name configurations clearly
  • Document configuration purposes
  • Keep configs active/inactive based on usage

Security

  • Restrict admin role to authorized users
  • Use user role for read-only access
  • Review ACLs on custom tables
  • Enable debug logging only for troubleshooting

Monitoring

  • Set up notifications for critical scores (<40)
  • Create dashboards to track health trends
  • Review top issues monthly
  • Prioritize high/medium severity issues

For Developers

  • Extending FHA: Create custom Issue Rules instead of modifying core scripts
  • Integration: Use REST API for automation and implement error handling
  • Code Quality: Follow ServiceNow best practices in custom scripts
  • Testing: Test custom rules on non-production instances first

Analysis Frequency Recommendations

Table Type Frequency Options
Critical production tables Daily Standard analysis
Standard tables (moderate activity) Weekly Standard or deep scan
Reference/configuration tables Monthly Quick health check
Historical/archived tables Quarterly Basic analysis
